meanings.definition: To take advantage of someone's generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: He always freeloaded off his friends by never offering to pay for anything.
meanings.sent2: She freeloaded off her parents for years, never once offering to help with expenses.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel freeloaded on the bird feeder, stealing seeds without contributing any nuts.
meanings.sent4: The lazy cat freeloaded on the warmth of the fireplace, not bothering to catch any mice.
meanings.sent5: The student freeloaded on the group project, not doing any work while taking credit for the final presentation.

meanings.definition: Someone who takes advantage of others' generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: The freeloader always expected others to cover their expenses without offering to contribute.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office freeloader, always taking food from the communal fridge without permission.
meanings.sent3: The freeloader at the party ate all the snacks without bringing anything to share.
meanings.sent4: The freeloader in the group chat never initiated plans but always joined in without contributing ideas.
meanings.sent5: The freeloader in the dormitory never did their share of the chores but always used the shared facilities.
